comment.narrative: of July 31st, 2021, NIMD hasn’t published any study to be used for lobby and advocacy. During 2021, NIMD have been working with Ideemos on “Páneles Ciudadanos” methodology to develop agile deliberations in municipalities. This methodology is based on deliberative democracy principles. Aims to have a qualified citizen participation, by setting up ad hoc deliberative body which will prioritize problems and design solutions based on the results of a wider citizen participation. Local authorities will be accountable whether the solutions presented by this ad hoc citizen body will be adopted or rejected.

In the framework of the National Paro, NIMD and Ideemos designed the methodology of Citizen Panels to promote citizen deliberation. 66 municipal governments, from the Democratic Centre party, were trained in the use of the methodology, however, the first 3 pilots will be carried out until 2022.

NIMD will not publish any study during 2021, as the implementation of the “Páneles Ciudadanos” methodology will take place in 2022 2. Based on those results, NIMD will publish a study with the methodology and results. By 2025, NIMD will have published 3 studies on innovative approaches to policy-oriented dialogue.

comment.narrative: By July 2021, NIMD has trained 434 young men and young women through 3 Democracy Schools and 10 training workshops for potential candidates to 2021 Youth Council Elections

837 young people were trained through 5 types of interventions.
1. The 8 Schools of Dialogue, Innovation and Leadership (EDIL) (or Democracy Schools) in 6 departments (Tolima, Cauca, La Guajira, Cordoba and Valle del Cauca) where the capacities of 165 young people were strengthened.
2. 466 young people from 13 departments of Colombia participated in 23 workshops for pre-candidates to the Municipal Youth Councils, delivered jointly by NIMD and the Ministry of Interior. 3. 128 young people from 6 departments attended 8 workshops conducted collaboratively by NIMD and the International Republican Institute (IRI). 4. Support to 4 training processes with 4 political parties, attended by 39 young people. And, the development of 3 Women's Political Empowerment Schools in 3 departments, attended by 39 young women.
In total, 837 young women strengthened their skills through the processes described above.
By December 2021, NIMD will have trained 900 young men and women, through 6 Democracy Schools and 20 online and face-to-face training workshops for Youth Councils candidates

comment.narrative: Since 2020 onwards, NIMD have been supporting Demolab, the innovation laboratory of the Bogota City Council, where civic actors and councilmembers jointly address local problems and challenges. During 2021-1 Demolab have developed two dialogue initiatives to address problems, such as police abuse, unemployment, gender inequality, voiced during the National Strike demonstrations. Demolab is the only (1) inclusive-policy-making process measured for baseline.
By December 2025, NIMD will support 7 inclusive policy-making processes (including Demolab) at the sub-national level, 6 of them will take place in 6 of the most conflict-affected territories.

comment.narrative: Zero (0) multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings implemented by July 2021 as part of inclusive policy-making processes at the subnational level.

Demolab carried out three multi-stakeholder dialogue initiatives in 2021, through 43 multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings
1. Council to the Streets: Through 2 face-to-face dialogue spaces, held at 2 of the most critical points of the National Strike mobilisation.
2. "Council to the House": Through 40 virtual meetings between 40 councillors and 360 citizens, to address the challenges of land use planning in Bogotá and nurture the debate on the draft Land Use Plan.
3. "Itinerant Citizen Assembly": 70 citizens, randomly selected, deliberated for 2 days, in 7 commissions and a plenary session, on the 7 thematic chapters of the draft Land Use Plan, to generate a report of recommendations that the Bogotá Council used during the debate on this regulation.
The changes in context explain why 43 multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings were held, despite the fact that no targets were planned for 2021 for IO 3.1.
Zero (0) multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings will be conducted in 2021. By December 2025, 49 multi-stakeholder meetings will take place at subnational level.
